block.title: Enable UDP Input
block.text: The default port to receive THOR events is 514/udp (standard SYSLOG port). The splunk daemon user needs administrative rights to open this port. Edit the "inputs.conf" in the add-on folder (TA_thor) to change the port to a different value and keep the rest of the configured values.

input.label: Disable the incoming UDP port 514 (default: disabled)

block.title: Configure THOR Scripted Input
block.text:
It is possible to run THOR on the endpoint via scripted input.
Check out the $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/TA-thor/bin/thor-remote.bat script.
It invokes thor.exe on a network share and indexes the output immediately. You just have to configure and set a network share on which the THOR program folder is located. With this method you don't have to use a UDP input as the THOR log output is read by the local splunk instance and automatically forwarded to the indexer.

The necessary steps are
  1. Provide the THOR program folder on a network share
  2. Configure the thor-remote.bat script on this host / on the deployment server
  3. Configure the interval (preferred: cron format)
